TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Volatile extends System.Object
public ref class Volatile abstract sealed

summary.span: 包含用于执行可变内存操作的方法。

span.span: Contains methods for performing volatile memory operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在多处理器系统中，易失性的写入操作可确保写入内存位置的值是立即可见的所有处理器。On a multiprocessor system, a volatile write operation ensures that a value written to a memory location is immediately visible to all processors. 易失性的读取的操作将获取由任何处理器写入的内存位置的最新值。A volatile read operation obtains the very latest value written to a memory location by any processor. 这些操作可能需要刷新处理器缓存，从而可能影响性能。These operations might require flushing processor caches, which can affect performance. > [!NOTE] > 在单处理器系统中，易失性的读取和写入确保值为读取或写入到内存中并不缓存 （例如，在处理器寄存器）。On a uniprocessor system, volatile reads and writes ensure that a value is read or written to memory and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，这些操作可用于同步对另一个线程或硬件可以更新字段的访问。Thus, you can use these operations to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread or by hardware. 可变内存操作适用的同步，特殊情况，正常锁定不是可接受的替代项。Volatile memory operations are for special cases of synchronization, where normal locking is not an acceptable alternative. 在正常情况下，C#`lock`语句，Visual Basic`SyncLock`语句，和类提供同步访问数据的最简单且最容易出错的方法和类提供一个简单的方法，可以编写延迟初始化代码，而直接使用双重检查锁定。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide the easiest and least error-prone way of synchronizing access to data, and the class provides a simple way to write lazy initialization code without directly using double-checked locking. 和方法启用中语言不支持的功能。The and methods enable functionality that is not supported in languages. 例如:For example: - 某些语言，如 Visual Basic 中，不能识别的可变内存操作的概念。Some languages, such as Visual Basic, do not recognize the concept of volatile memory operations. 类提供该功能在这种语言。The class provides that functionality in such languages. > [!NOTE] > 调用这些方法之一只影响单个内存访问。Calling one of these methods affects only a single memory access. 若要提供字段的有效同步，对字段的所有访问必须都使用和。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use and . - 在 C# 中，使用`volatile`字段上的修饰符可保证每次访问该字段使用和方法，但`volatile`修饰符不能应用于数组元素。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that every access to that field uses the and methods, but the `volatile` modifier cannot be applied to array elements. 和方法可在数组元素。The and methods can be used on array elements.

summary.span: 读取字段值。

span.span: Reads the value of a field.

summary.span: 在需要进行此操作的系统上，插入防止处理器重新对内存操作进行排序的内存屏障，如下所示：如果读取或写入操作在代码中出现在此方法之后，则处理器无法将其移至此方法之前。

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears after this method in the code, the processor cannot move it before this method.

Public Shared Function Read (ByRef location As Boolean) As Boolean
public: static bool Read(bool % location);

span.span: The value that was read.

returns.span: 无论处理器的数目或处理器缓存的状态如何，该值都是由计算机的任何处理器写入的最新值。

span.span: This value is the latest written by any processor in the computer, regardless of the number of processors or the state of processor cache.

summary.span: 在需要进行此操作的系统上，插入防止处理器重新对内存操作进行排序的内存屏障，如下所示：如果读取或写入操作在代码中出现在此方法之前，则处理器无法将其移至此方法之后。

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears before this method in the code, the processor cannot move it after this method.
